newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia Vimpelcom telecom sale to boost ADR float.
newsitem.headline: Russia Vimpelcom telecom sale to boost ADR float.

text.p: A U.S. investment vehicle will liquidate its holdings this week in Russian telecoms firm Vimpelcom and the shares will be sold in American Depositary Receipt (ADR) form, Renaissance Capital bank said on Thursday.

"The ADR float will increase from 24 percent to 38 percent (of capital) based on this offering," Renaissance investment banking co-head Alan Apter told Reuters. ADRs allow foreign trading of local shares.

FGI Wireless Ltd will sell 3.458 million shares in Vimpelcom (Vympelkom in Russian), a cellular phone operator, raising ADR-covered capital to about $300 million from $190 million, he said. Vimpelcom's total market capitalisation is $800 million.
Apter said Renaissance and Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette would place over $100 million of the ADRs, which are being sold to increase liquidity of the stake and pay taxes.
Vimpelcom ADRs, each covering three quarters of one underlying share, closed at $30-3/4 on the New York Stock Exchange on Wednesday after $31-5/8 on Tuesday.
Vimpelcom shares last traded on the Russian Trading System on May 8 for $43.50.
